turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Mettā.
turn.1: What is the English translation of Venda?
turn.2: Buswell and Lopez, as well as Harvey, translate "metta" as "loving-kindness".
turn.3: What is the importance of Mett ⁇ ?
turn.4: In Buddhist belief, this is a "Brahma-vihara" (divine abode) or an immeasurable that leads to a meditative state by being a counter to ill-will.
turn.5: How successful were the people who used Mett?
turn.6: It removes clinging to negative state of mind, by cultivating kindness unto all beings.
turn.7: What did the experts say about Mett?
turn.8: The "far enemy" of Metta is hate or ill-will, a mind-state in obvious opposition.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The "near enemy" (quality which superficially resembles Metta but is in fact more subtly in opposition to it), is (attached) greed: here too one likes seeing a virtue, but for the wrong reason.
turn.11: Was there anything else interesting they said?
turn.12: Mettā meditation, or often loving-kindness meditation, is the practice concerned with the cultivation of Mettā, i.e. benevolence, kindness, and amity.
